info.title: MileApp Fullstack Test
info.description:
## Introduction
This documentation describes the **Mock API** built for the *MileApp Fullstack Test*.
The API simulates authentication and task management endpoints without using a real database.
It is designed to demonstrate backend API structure, response standards, and frontend integration readiness.

Use this reference to understand how to:
- Authenticate using the `/api/login` endpoint.
- Manage tasks through standard CRUD routes under `/api/tasks`.

All endpoints return mock data in **JSON** format and require **Bearer token authentication** for protected routes.

---

## HTTP Methods
| Method | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| **GET** | Retrieve one or more resources |
| **POST** | Create a new resource |
| **PUT** | Update an existing resource |
| **DELETE** | Remove a resource |

---

## HTTP Status Codes
| Code | Description |
|------|-------------|
| **200** | OK — Request succeeded |
| **201** | Created — Resource created successfully |
| **204** | No Content — Request succeeded, no body returned |
| **400** | Bad Request — The request was malformed |
| **401** | Unauthorized — Missing or invalid Bearer token |
| **403** | Forbidden — Authenticated but not permitted |
| **404** | Not Found — The resource does not exist |
| **422** | Unprocessable Entity — Validation failed |
| **500** | Internal Server Error — Unexpected server failure |

---

### Notes
- All timestamps use **ISO 8601** format.
- Example data is generated statically for demonstration.
- You can download the full OpenAPI specification at the top of this page.
